subhead: As peace talks with Washington continue, the Kremlin is trying to convince the world that a Russian victory is inevitable, even though its army is advancing slowly and suffering heavy losses.

Life sentence sought for DRC former rebel leader at French trial
subhead: Roger Lumbala, 67, is on trial in Paris, accused of complicity in crimes against humanity during the Second Congo War (1998-2003). For human rights organizations, the trial is an opportunity to challenge the impunity enjoyed by warring parties in eastern Democratic Republic of Congo.

title: Democrats release new cache of Epstein photos
subhead: The photos feature such high-profile figures as Donald Trump, Woody Allen and former president Bill Clinton. Although the undated photos do not appear to depict any unlawful conduct, Democrats maintain that the 'images raise even more questions about Epstein and his relationships with some of the most powerful men in the world.'

title: 'Am I Next?': In Los Angeles, a city targeted by ICE raids, an exhibition invites self-reflection
subhead: In response to raids by Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) agents, the facades of several buildings across the California metropolis display the message 'Am I Next?' along with the photo of an ordinary citizen. This open-air campaign serves as both an act of resistance and a manifesto intended to alert the broader public.

title: Paris Agreement: Ten years later, key players look back on 'incredible alignment of stars'
subhead: Le Monde takes a look back at the the signing of the Paris Agreement in the French capital on December 12, 2015, a major geopolitical agreement reached after two weeks of intense negotiations that aimed to limit global warming to 'well below' 2°C and at 'pursuing efforts' to keep the temperature increase to 1.5°C.

The mysterious 'knocker' scaring elderly women in a Brittany town
subhead: For more than two years, a prowler has been knocking on doors and shutters during the night in a village in Brittany, France, creating a climate of fear among his preferred targets: elderly women. Authorities were slow to take the case seriously.

title: Ukraine ready to consider Donbas demilitarized zone in concession to end war
subhead: Mykhailo Podolyak, an advisor to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky, tells Le Monde that the zone would require Ukrainian and Russian forces to both pull back from the front line.

title: Israel's reign of terror over the West Bank
subhead: Deadly shootings by the army, beatings by settlers, devastating raids, arbitrary arrests, torture in prison: The level of violence inflicted on Palestinians living in the territory has never been so high since the Israeli occupation began in 1967.
